org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.acting
Class ArticleImageUploadCreatorAction

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.apache.avalon.framework.logger.AbstractLogEnabled
        |
        +--org.apache.cocoon.acting.AbstractAction
              |
              +--org.apache.cocoon.acting.AbstractConfigurableAction
                    |
                    +--org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.acting.ArticleImageUploadCreatorAction
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.cocoon.acting.Action, org.apache.avalon.framework.component.Component, org.apache.avalon.framework.configuration.Configurable, org.apache.avalon.framework.logger.LogEnabled, org.apache.avalon.framework.thread.ThreadSafe
Deprecated. this class is very specific to the unipublic publication as it inserts very specific tags into the original document. This action has been superceded by the AssetUploadAction and the ant tasks which take care of inserting tags in the original document in a configurable way.

public class ArticleImageUploadCreatorAction
extends org.apache.cocoon.acting.AbstractConfigurableAction
implements org.apache.avalon.framework.thread.ThreadSafe

The class ArticleImageUploadCreatorAction implements an action that allows for image upload.

Author:
Christian Egli
See Also:
org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.acting, task for inserting of assets

insertMediaTag

protected void insertMediaTag(java.lang.String requestingDocumentPath,
                              java.lang.String imageXPath,
                              java.lang.String imagePath,
                              java.util.HashMap dublinCoreParams)
                       throws org.dom4j.DocumentException,
                              java.io.IOException
Deprecated. 
Insert <media> tags at the location specified by the xpath in the original document (the requestingDocumentPath)

Parameters:
requestingDocumentPath - the xml document from where the image upload request originated.
imageXPath - the xpath after which the image is to be inserted.
imagePath - path name of the uploaded image
dublinCoreParams - a HashMap of additional values according to Dublin Core.
Throws:
org.dom4j.DocumentException - if an error occurs
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs

getImagePath

protected java.lang.String getImagePath(java.lang.String sitemapPath,
                                        java.lang.String recourcesRoot,
                                        java.lang.String documentId,
                                        java.lang.String fileName)
Deprecated. 
Figure out where the image is to be stored. The default implementation simply concatenates the sitemapPath and recourcesRoot (which is defined in the sitemap) with the parent of documentId and the filename. Derived classes might want to change this into more elaborate schemes, i.e. store the image together with the document where the image is inserted.

Parameters:
sitemapPath - a String value
recourcesRoot - a String value
documentId - a String value
fileName - a String value
Returns:
a String value

getMetaDataPath

protected java.lang.String getMetaDataPath(java.lang.String sitemapPath,
                                           java.lang.String metaRoot,
                                           java.lang.String documentId,
                                           java.lang.String fileName)
Deprecated. 
Figure out where the meta data file is to be stored. The default implementation simply concatenates the sitemapPath and metaRoot (which is defined in the sitemap) with the parent of documentId and the filename.

Parameters:
sitemapPath - a String value
metaRoot - a String value
documentId - a String value
fileName - a String value
Returns:
a String value

getResourcePath

protected java.lang.String getResourcePath(java.lang.String sitemapPath,
                                           java.lang.String recourcesRoot,
                                           java.lang.String documentId,
                                           java.lang.String fileName)
Deprecated. 
A simple helper method for the getFooPath methods, which simply concatenates the given filenames. If a filename is null it is ignored.

Parameters:
sitemapPath - a String value
recourcesRoot - a String value
documentId - a String value
fileName - a String value
Returns:
a String value
